author: Chris Kornelis
title: An Antivirus Pioneer Looks at the Coming Cyberthreats
text:
Back in 1987, when the idea of a virus to most computer users meant having a fever and runny nose, Andreas Lüning discovered one on his computer. In short order, the German software company he co-founded, G Data Software AG, released the AntiVirusKit, one of the first such programs ever created.
In the three decades since, he has been warning the public about the dangers of computer viruses and urging them to protect themselves. He says his mission hasn’t gotten any easier—even at a time when data breaches and ransomware attacks... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
